verses.verse: The word <S%H1697><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> that came to Joel <S%H3100><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Pethuel <S%H6602><s%>.

Hear <S%H8085><s%> this, ye old men <S%H2205><s%>, and give ear <S%H238><s%>, all ye inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%>. Hath this been in your days <S%H3117><s%>, or even <S%H518><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of your fathers <S%H1><s%>?

Tell <S%H5608><s%> ye your children <S%H1121><s%> of it, and let your children <S%H1121><s%> tell their children <S%H1121><s%>, and their children <S%H1121><s%> another <S%H312><s%> generation <S%H1755><s%>.

That which the palmerworm <S%H1501><s%> hath left <S%H3499><s%> hath the locust <S%H697><s%> eaten <S%H398><s%>; and that which the locust <S%H697><s%> hath left <S%H3499><s%> hath the cankerworm <S%H3218><s%> eaten <S%H398><s%>; and that which the cankerworm <S%H3218><s%> hath left <S%H3499><s%> hath the caterpiller <S%H2625><s%> eaten <S%H398><s%>. That which the palmerworm: Heb. The residue of the palmerworm

Awake <S%H6974><s%>, ye drunkards <S%H7910><s%>, and weep <S%H1058><s%>; and howl <S%H3213><s%>, all ye drinkers <S%H8354><s%> of wine <S%H3196><s%>, because of the new wine <S%H6071><s%>; for it is cut off <S%H3772><s%> from your mouth <S%H6310><s%>.

For a nation <S%H1471><s%> is come up <S%H5927><s%> upon my land <S%H776><s%>, strong <S%H6099><s%>, and without number <S%H4557><s%>, whose teeth <S%H8127><s%> are the teeth <S%H8127><s%> of a lion <S%H738><s%>, and he hath the cheek teeth <S%H4973><s%> of a great lion <S%H3833><s%>.

He hath laid <S%H7760><s%> my vine <S%H1612><s%> waste <S%H8047><s%>, and barked <S%H7111><s%> my fig tree <S%H8384><s%>: he hath made it clean <S%H2834><s%> bare <S%H2834><s%>, and cast it away <S%H7993><s%>; the branches <S%H8299><s%> thereof are made white <S%H3835><s%>. barked: Heb. laid my fig tree for a barking
Lament <S%H421><s%> like a virgin <S%H1330><s%> girded <S%H2296><s%> with sackcloth <S%H8242><s%> for the husband <S%H1167><s%> of her youth <S%H5271><s%>.

The meat offering <S%H4503><s%> and the drink offering <S%H5262><s%> is cut off <S%H3772><s%> from the house <S%H1004><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>; the priests <S%H3548><s%>, the LORD'S <S%H3068><s%> ministers <S%H8334><s%>, mourn <S%H56><s%>.

The field <S%H7704><s%> is wasted <S%H7703><s%>, the land <S%H127><s%> mourneth <S%H56><s%>; for the corn <S%H1715><s%> is wasted <S%H7703><s%>: the new wine <S%H8492><s%> is dried up <S%H3001><s%>, the oil <S%H3323><s%> languisheth <S%H535><s%>.

Be ye ashamed <S%H3001><s%>, O ye husbandmen <S%H406><s%>; howl <S%H3213><s%>, O ye vinedressers <S%H3755><s%>, for the wheat <S%H2406><s%> and for the barley <S%H8184><s%>; because the harvest <S%H7105><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> is perished <S%H6><s%>.

The vine <S%H1612><s%> is dried up <S%H3001><s%>, and the fig tree <S%H8384><s%> languisheth <S%H535><s%>; the pomegranate <S%H7416><s%> tree, the palm tree <S%H8558><s%> also, and the apple tree <S%H8598><s%>, even all the trees <S%H6086><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%>, are withered <S%H3001><s%>: because joy <S%H8342><s%> is withered away <S%H3001><s%> from the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%>.

Gird <S%H2296><s%> yourselves, and lament <S%H5594><s%>, ye priests <S%H3548><s%>: howl <S%H3213><s%>, ye ministers <S%H8334><s%> of the altar <S%H4196><s%>: come <S%H935><s%>, lie all night <S%H3885><s%> in sackcloth <S%H8242><s%>, ye ministers <S%H8334><s%> of my God <S%H430><s%>: for the meat offering <S%H4503><s%> and the drink offering <S%H5262><s%> is withholden <S%H4513><s%> from the house <S%H1004><s%> of your God <S%H430><s%>.

Sanctify <S%H6942><s%> ye a fast <S%H6685><s%>, call <S%H7121><s%> a solemn assembly <S%H6116><s%>, gather <S%H622><s%> the elders <S%H2205><s%> and all the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> into the house <S%H1004><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%>, and cry <S%H2199><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, solemn: or, day of restraint

Alas <S%H162><s%> for the day <S%H3117><s%>! for the day <S%H3117><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is at hand <S%H7138><s%>, and as a destruction <S%H7701><s%> from the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> shall it come <S%H935><s%>.
Is not the meat <S%H400><s%> cut off <S%H3772><s%> before our eyes <S%H5869><s%>, yea, joy <S%H8057><s%> and gladness <S%H1524><s%> from the house <S%H1004><s%> of our God <S%H430><s%>?

The seed <S%H6507><s%> is rotten <S%H5685><s%> under their clods <S%H4053><s%>, the garners <S%H214><s%> are laid desolate <S%H8074><s%>, the barns <S%H4460><s%> are broken down <S%H2040><s%>; for the corn <S%H1715><s%> is withered <S%H3001><s%>. seed: Heb. grains

How do the beasts <S%H929><s%> groan <S%H584><s%>! the herds <S%H5739><s%> of cattle <S%H1241><s%> are perplexed <S%H943><s%>, because they have no pasture <S%H4829><s%>; yea, the flocks <S%H5739><s%> of sheep <S%H6629><s%> are made desolate <S%H816><s%>.

O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, to thee will I cry <S%H7121><s%>: for the fire <S%H784><s%> hath devoured <S%H398><s%> the pastures <S%H4999><s%> of the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>, and the flame <S%H3852><s%> hath burned <S%H3857><s%> all the trees <S%H6086><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%>. pastures: or, habitations

The beasts <S%H929><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%> cry <S%H6165><s%> also unto thee: for the rivers <S%H650><s%> of waters <S%H4325><s%> are dried up <S%H3001><s%>, and the fire <S%H784><s%> hath devoured <S%H398><s%> the pastures <S%H4999><s%> of the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>.
